newsitem.title: SPAIN: ATHLETICS-PINTUSEVICH RUNS SECOND FASTEST TIME OF THE YEAR.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-PINTUSEVICH RUNS SECOND FASTEST TIME OF THE YEAR.

text.p: Zhanna Pintusevich ran the second fastest women's 200 metres of the year on Wednesday at an athletics meeting at a high-altitude training centre.
The Ukrainian ran 22.17 seconds into a wind of 2.3 metres per second at the meeting in the southern Spanish mountains at a height of 2,320 metres.
Pintusevich, the 1994 European championship silver medallist, followed up with a 100-metres victory in 11.14 seconds.
Olympic champion Lydmilla Enquist of Sweden won the women's 100 metres hurdles in 12.67 seconds.
Only Enquist herself and American Melissa Morrison have run faster this year.
Charity Opara of Nigeria also took advantage of the altitude and clocked 49.79 seconds in the women's 400 metres, the third-fastest time of the year over one lap.
Cuba's world record-holding high jumper Javier Sotomayor produced his best performance since he limped out of the Olympic final last year.
Sotomayor, the 1991 and 1993 men's world champion, cleared 2.30 metres.
Since his poor showing in Atlanta, Sotomayor has had operations on his left knee and ankle.
